meta.title: Session 05: Advanced Email, Data Entry & Windows Tools
meta.description: Focuses on professional email features (Confidential mode, Undo Send), Data Entry industry insights (OCR, Transcription), AI typing assistants, and Windows system tools like Snipping Tool and Action Center.

questions.question: Which Gmail feature allows you to 'recall' an email shortly after clicking the Send button?
questions.explanation: The 'Undo Send' feature gives you a short window (e.g., 5-30 seconds) to cancel the delivery of an email.

questions.question: What is the primary function of OCR (Optical Character Recognition) software in data entry?
options: To convert scanned images of text into editable text formats
questions.explanation: OCR technology analyzes images of text (like scanned documents) and converts them into machine-encoded text that can be edited.

questions.question: You need to send a sensitive document via Gmail that expires after 1 day and cannot be forwarded. Which mode should you use?
questions.explanation: Confidential Mode allows senders to set expiration dates and revoke access to messages, and it disables options to forward, copy, print, or download.

questions.question: Which Windows tool is used to capture a screenshot of a specific portion of your screen?
questions.explanation: The Snipping Tool is a utility included in Windows to take screenshots of an open window, rectangular areas, a free-form area, or the entire screen.

questions.question: What is 'Medical Transcription'?
options: Converting voice-recorded reports from physicians into text documents
questions.explanation: Medical transcriptionists listen to voice recordings made by doctors and type them into written medical reports.

questions.question: Which area in Windows 10 displays notifications and quick settings (like Wi-Fi, Bluetooth)?
questions.explanation: The Action Center creates a unified place for all system notifications and provides quick access to key settings.

questions.question: Microsoft SwiftKey is an example of what type of AI tool?
questions.explanation: SwiftKey is a smart keyboard app that uses AI to learn your writing style, including slang, nicknames, and emojis, for better prediction.

questions.question: In the context of banking documents, what does 'KYC' stand for?
questions.explanation: KYC (Know Your Customer) is the process of verifying the identity of clients to prevent fraud and illegal activities.

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'Windows Update'?
options: To keep the operating system secure and install the latest features/fixes
questions.explanation: Windows Update provides essential service packs, security patches, and other updates to keep the computer secure and running smoothly.

questions.question: Which folder on the Windows Desktop stores deleted files temporarily before they are permanently erased?
questions.explanation: The Recycle Bin holds deleted files, allowing you to restore them if you deleted them by mistake.

questions.question: What is 'Data Validation' in the context of data entry?
options: Checking data for accuracy and quality before using it
questions.explanation: Data validation ensures that the data entered into a system meets specific criteria (e.g., ensuring a phone number field only contains numbers).

questions.question: Which Google tool allows you to type text by speaking into your microphone?
questions.explanation: Voice Typing in Google Docs uses speech recognition AI to convert spoken words into text in real-time.

questions.question: Why would you use an 'Email Template' in Gmail?
options: To respond quickly to common emails using pre-written text
questions.explanation: Templates save you from typing the same response repeatedly by allowing you to insert pre-saved text blocks.

questions.question: What is 'Cortana' in Windows 10?
options: A digital voice assistant developed by Microsoft
questions.explanation: Cortana is Microsoft's productivity assistant that helps you save time and focus on what matters (though its role has evolved in newer Windows versions).

questions.question: Which of the following is a key reason to install Anti-Virus software?
options: To protect the computer from malware and cyber threats
To increase the hard drive size
questions.explanation: Anti-virus software detects, prevents, and removes malicious software (malware) to ensure cyber safety.

questions.question: If you want to view all open windows and switch between virtual desktops, which button on the taskbar should you click?
questions.explanation: The Task View button allows you to see all open apps at once and manage multiple virtual desktops.

questions.question: Why might a user change the 'System Language' settings in Windows?
options: To use the computer interface in their local language (e.g., Hindi, Marathi)
questions.explanation: Language settings allow users to read menus, dialog boxes, and other interface items in their preferred language.

questions.question: In Gmail, what is the function of a 'Read Receipt'?
options: To notify the sender that the recipient has opened the email
questions.explanation: A Read Receipt is a notification sent to the sender confirming that the recipient has opened/read the email.

questions.question: Type Fu is mentioned as:
options: An AI Typing Tutor to learn touch typing
questions.explanation: Type Fu is an application designed to help users learn and master touch typing.

questions.question: What appears when you hover your mouse pointer over an icon without clicking?
questions.explanation: A Tool Tip is a brief informative message that appears when a user interacts with an element (like hovering over it).
